studyTitle: Pentadecapeptide BPC 157 and its effects on gastrointestinal healing and angiogenesis
abstract: BPC 157 accelerates healing of transected Achilles tendon, transected quadriceps muscle, and crushed muscle. The peptide exhibits angiogenic properties and promotes granulation tissue formation. It modulates growth hormone receptor expression and improves tendon-to-bone healing.
dosing: 250-500 mcg subcutaneous or oral twice daily; cycle 4-8 weeks

sources.title: BPC 157 and gastrointestinal healing: systematic review
Pentadecapeptide BPC 157 and tendon-to-bone healing in rats
BPC 157 angiogenic effects in muscle injury model

studyTitle: Thymosin β4 promotes dermal wound repair and regeneration
abstract: TB-500 accelerates wound healing through increased cell migration, angiogenesis, and collagen deposition. Significant improvement in tensile strength of healed tissue. Promotes stem cell migration and differentiation.

sources.title: Thymosin β4 and dermal wound repair: clinical perspectives
TB-500 promotes collagen deposition in rat tendon model

studyTitle: Epithalamin (epitalon) extends lifespan and suppresses tumor development in aged mice
abstract: Epitalon restores melatonin rhythm and extends mean lifespan. Reduces spontaneous tumor incidence and normalizes immune function in elderly subjects. Increases telomerase activity in human cell cultures.
dosing: 10 mg subcutaneous daily; 20-day cycles, 3-4x per year

sources.title: Epitalon extends lifespan and suppresses tumors in aged mice
Telomerase activity and pineal peptides: systematic review

studyTitle: Copper peptide GHK-Cu in skin repair and anti-aging
abstract: GHK-Cu stimulates collagen and elastin synthesis, promotes wound healing, and exhibits antioxidant activity. Improves skin firmness and reduces fine lines. Modulates gene expression for tissue repair.

sources.title: GHK-Cu in skin repair: randomized controlled trial
Copper peptides and collagen synthesis: meta-analysis

studyTitle: Semaglutide 2.4 mg for weight management: STEP trials
abstract: Once-weekly semaglutide 2.4 mg produces sustained weight loss and improvement in cardiometabolic risk factors in adults with obesity. Reduces HbA1c and cardiovascular events in type 2 diabetes.
dosing: 0.25 mg weekly, titrate to 2.4 mg over 16-20 weeks; maintenance 2.4 mg weekly

sources.title: STEP 1: Semaglutide 2.4 mg for obesity—phase 3 RCT
Semaglutide and cardiovascular outcomes in type 2 diabetes
GLP-1 receptor agonists for weight management: systematic review

studyTitle: Dual GIP/GLP-1 agonist tirzepatide for type 2 diabetes and obesity
abstract: Tirzepatide achieves superior HbA1c and body weight reduction vs semaglutide. Cardiovascular outcomes and safety profile support long-term use. Dual receptor agonism enhances metabolic effects.
dosing: 2.5 mg weekly, titrate to 5-15 mg over 20 weeks; maintenance 5-15 mg weekly

sources.title: SURPASS-2: Tirzepatide vs semaglutide in type 2 diabetes
SURMOUNT-1: Tirzepatide for obesity—phase 3 trial
Dual GIP/GLP-1 agonists: mechanism and clinical use

studyTitle: Selective growth hormone secretagogue: ipamorelin and GH release
abstract: Ipamorelin selectively stimulates GH release without affecting cortisol or prolactin. Promotes lean mass retention and fat loss in clinical trials. Minimal side effects due to selectivity.

sources.title: Ipamorelin and GH release: double-blind placebo-controlled study
Selective GHS and cortisol sparing: comparative review

studyTitle: Long-acting growth hormone releasing hormone analog CJC-1295
abstract: CJC-1295 extends half-life of GHRH and sustains elevated GH and IGF-1 for days. Well tolerated with dose-dependent increases in IGF-1. Single dose maintains elevated GH for 6+ days.
dosing: 1-2 mg subcutaneous 1-2x per week; cycle 8-12 weeks

sources.title: CJC-1295 pharmacokinetics and IGF-1 in healthy adults
Long-acting GHRH analogs: clinical applications

studyTitle: Melanotan II: pharmacokinetics and effects on pigmentation
abstract: MT-II induces melanogenesis and erectile activity via MC receptor agonism. Single-dose pharmacokinetics support subcutaneous administration. Tanning effects with reduced UV exposure.
dosing: 0.5-1 mg subcutaneous daily for loading; maintenance 1-2x/week

sources.title: Melanotan II pharmacokinetics and pigmentation
MC receptor agonists: pharmacology and safety

studyTitle: Thymosin α1 as an immunomodulatory agent in viral infections and cancer
abstract: Ta1 enhances T-cell maturation and cytokine production. Improves outcomes in chronic hepatitis B/C and as adjuvant in cancer immunotherapy. Restores immune function in immunocompromised patients.
dosing: 1.6 mg subcutaneous 2x/week; cycle 4-12 weeks depending on indication

sources.title: Thymosin α1 in chronic hepatitis B: meta-analysis
Ta1 as adjuvant in cancer immunotherapy: phase 2 trial

abstract: Semax improves cognitive function, memory, and attention. Neuroprotective in ischemia and stress. Modulates BDNF and endorphin systems. Used in stroke recovery and cognitive enhancement.
dosing: 200-800 mcg intranasal or subcutaneous daily; cycle 2-4 weeks

sources.title: Semax in acute stroke: randomized controlled trial
ACTH(4-10) fragment peptides: neuroprotection review

abstract: Selank reduces anxiety and improves learning. Modulates serotonin and immune system. Antidepressant-like effects in animal models. Enhances GABA and reduces anxiety without sedation.
dosing: 200-400 mcg intranasal or subcutaneous daily; cycle 2-4 weeks

sources.title: Selank in generalized anxiety: pilot RCT
Immunomodulatory peptides and anxiety: systematic review

studyTitle: Dihexa: hepatocyte growth factor mimetic for cognitive enhancement
abstract: Dihexa crosses blood-brain barrier and promotes neurogenesis. Enhances memory and synaptic connectivity. Hepatocyte growth factor mimetic with potential in Alzheimer's and cognitive decline.

sources.title: Dihexa and hippocampal neurogenesis in rodent model
HGF mimetics in cognitive disorders: review

abstract: PTN-166 promotes hippocampal neurogenesis and protects neurons from cell death. Improves cognitive function in models of neurodegeneration. Enhances NAD+ and mitochondrial function.
dosing: Research phase; oral dosing in development

sources.title: P7C3 compounds and neurogenesis in mouse model
Neuroprotective small molecules: NAD+ and mitochondria

studyTitle: AOD-9604: fragment of growth hormone for fat metabolism
abstract: AOD-9604 is a modified fragment of GH that stimulates fat metabolism without growth effects. Promotes lipolysis and reduces body fat in clinical studies. No effect on blood sugar or IGF-1.

sources.title: AOD-9604 for obesity: phase 2 randomized trial
GH fragments and lipolysis: mechanism review
